content.user_title: Write and Debug Tests with Playwright, Vitest, and Storybook
content.value_statement: Writing and maintaining tests is time-consuming and error-prone without the right expertise. This skill provides expert guidance for creating Playwright E2E tests, Vitest unit tests, and Storybook interaction tests for TypeScript and React applications.
actual_capabilities: Write Playwright E2E browser tests for user workflows
Create Vitest unit and integration tests for components and utilities
Build Storybook interaction tests for visual component states
Debug failing tests with step-by-step troubleshooting guidance
Set up test infrastructure with proper fixtures and helpers
Improve test coverage following testing best practices
limitations: Cannot run tests without an existing test environment and dependencies
Cannot access third-party APIs or services not defined in the project
Does not perform visual regression testing or screenshot comparisons
Requires project to use Playwright, Vitest, or Storybook for respective test types

use_cases.title: Onboard to testing

use_cases.title: Set up test infrastructure

prompt_templates.title: Set up tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up testing for my project. I want to write Playwright E2E tests for my React application. Show me the file structure, test pattern, and how to create a helper class for common editor operations.

prompt_templates.title: Write E2E test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Playwright E2E test for the login feature. Before writing, read the Login component source file to identify the correct selectors. Test that users can enter credentials and successfully sign in.

prompt_templates.title: Debug failing test
prompt_templates.prompt: My Playwright test is failing intermittently. The error says the toolbar button is not visible. Help me debug this. I am using the title attribute to locate buttons. What might be causing this flakiness?

prompt_templates.title: Increase coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my test coverage report and suggest the most impactful tests to add. Prioritize user-facing workflows and edge cases. Show me specific test cases I should add for the editor component.

output_examples.input: Write a Playwright E2E test for the login feature
output: First, I will read the Login component source to identify stable selectors like data-testid or title attributes.
Then I will create a test file following the project conventions with beforeEach setup and helper methods.

output_examples.input: How do I write unit tests for a custom React hook?
output: Use Vitest with Testing Library. Create a hook-name.test.ts file.
Use renderHook to test initial state and state updates with act() for async operations.

output_examples.input: My test is failing because it cannot find the button
output: The selector may be fragile. Check if the button uses data-testid, title, or aria-label attributes.
If not, read the component source to find stable identifiers. Avoid CSS classes and XPath which can break with styling changes.

best_practices: Use stable selectors like data-testid and aria-label instead of CSS classes or XPath
Follow the reconnaissance-then-action pattern: read component source before writing tests
Write independent tests that do not depend on execution order or shared state
anti_patterns: Guessing selectors without reading the source code first
Testing implementation details instead of user-facing behavior
Creating tests that depend on other tests running before them

faq.question: What browsers does Playwright test support?
faq.answer: Playwright supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit. This covers Chrome, Edge, Safari, and mobile browsers.

faq.question: How many test files should I create?
faq.answer: Organize tests by feature, not by test type. One spec file per feature keeps tests focused and maintainable.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Playwright and Vitest work with GitHub Actions, CircleCI, and other CI systems. Use the CI flag for reliable runs.

faq.question: Does this skill store or share my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads your local files to write tests. Code never leaves your machine or project directory.

faq.question: Why are my tests flaky and failing intermittently?
faq.answer: Common causes include timing issues, network dependencies, or shared state. Use explicit waits and isolate test data.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on modern JavaScript testing with Playwright for E2E, Vitest for unit tests, and Storybook for component tests.
